p: Although the Government of Canada and various provincial public health authorities have existing strategies in place to reduce the burden of Lyme disease, more research is needed to better understand the evidence-informed process of responding to climate change and its related health risks. Further research needs to include an evaluation of the existing response strategies in public health systems as well as an investigation of potential factors which may constrain or facilitate the planning and/or the implementation of strategies over time and across localities. Such research could inform the planning and implementation of best practice strategies in response to the ever-expanding health impacts of climate change [10].
